```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(xtable)
require(data.table) #need to convert for latex export
```


## Table 1: Descriptive Statistics by County for all counties, all counties with monitors, rural counties, rural counties with monitors (AI/Non-AI)

Characteristics include: number of counties, mean annual PM2.5 monitor count, mean monitor PM2.5 concentration, mean model PM2.5 concentration, mean population density, mean household income.

I created two tables, one with all counties and counties with monitors (first chunk), the next with rural counties and rural counties with monitors (second chunk).

August 4 update: fixed the mean annual concentrations by monitor and SD

September 9 update: added ADI descriptive statistics

```{r ADI}
adi_blckgrp = read_delim("Data/adi-download/US_2015_ADI_Census Block Group_v3.1.txt",
                         delim = ",")
substr(adi_blckgrp$FIPS, 1, 5)

adi_county = adi_blckgrp %>% 
  mutate(County = substr(FIPS, 1, 5),
         ADI_NATRANK = as.numeric(ADI_NATRANK), 
         ADI_STATERNK = as.numeric(ADI_STATERNK)) %>% 
  dplyr::select(County, ADI_NATRANK, ADI_STATERNK) %>% 
  group_by(County) %>% 
  summarize(mean_nat_adi = mean(ADI_NATRANK, na.rm = TRUE),
            mean_state_adi = mean(ADI_STATERNK, na.rm = TRUE))
```

### Rural Counties
Note: I use the same variable names as above in intermediate steps for calculating each of the characteristics (overwriting values), so please run each chunk in their entirety to ensure the output tables

**Definition of Rural Counties:** Micropolitan and Non-Core
Source: https://www.hrsa.gov/rural-health/about-us/definition/index.html#:~:text=All%20counties%20that%20are%20not,as%20either%20Metro%20or%20Micro

"Micropolitan counties are considered non-Metropolitan or rural along with all counties that are not classified as either Metro or Micro. "


### 7/30/21 Revision: Correlation Matrix
```{r}
acs5 <- load_variables(2010, "acs5", cache = TRUE)

all_native_counties_full
all_general_counties_full
all_counties_full = rbind(all_native_counties_full, all_general_counties_full)
all_counties_full

## Estimate!!Total!!Below 100 percent of the poverty level
## Variable name: B06012_002

poverty_acs = get_acs(geography = "county",
                          variables = "B06012_002",
                          year = 2010) %>% 
  rename(County = GEOID,
         poverty_count = estimate) %>% 
  dplyr::select(County, poverty_count)

vehicle_acs = get_acs(geography = "county",
                          variables = "B08201_002",
                          year = 2010) %>% 
  rename(County = GEOID) %>% 
  rename(no_v_count = estimate) %>% 
  dplyr::select(County, no_v_count)


all_counties_full = all_counties_full %>% 
  inner_join(poverty_acs) %>% 
  inner_join(vehicle_acs) %>% 
  mutate(total_pop = as.numeric(total_pop),
         poverty_rate = poverty_count/total_pop,
         no_v_rate = no_v_count/total_pop) 

### Calculate correlations

## join all dfs for correlation matrix
data_cormat <- all_counties_full %>% 
  dplyr::select(-County, -total_pop, -State, -EPA_region, -Climate_Zone) %>% 
  mutate(land_use = as.numeric(land_use))
data_cormat

v.matrix <- round(cor(data_cormat, use = "pairwise.complete.obs", 
                    method = c("spearman")), 2)

v.matrix[upper.tri(v.matrix)] <- NA          

viz.cormat <- reshape2::melt(v.matrix, na.rm = TRUE) %>% 
  dplyr::rename(Correlation = value) 

 v.matrix
 
### Visualization

viz.cormat %>%
    ggplot(aes(Var1, Var2, fill = Correlation)) +
 geom_tile(color = "white") +
 scale_fill_gradient2(low = "blue", high = "red", mid = "white", 
                      midpoint = 0.5,  space = "Lab", 
                      name = "Spearman\nCorrelation") +
  geom_text(aes(Var1, Var2, label = Correlation), color = "black", size = 5) +
#  theme_minimal(base_size = 14) + # minimal theme
  theme(
```
